organization.fullName: Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca

identificationModule.briefTitle: Inspiratory Muscle Training in Patients With Stroke in Subacute Phase.
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effects of Inspiratory Muscle Training on Lung Function, Inspiratory Muscle Strength and Trunk Balance in Patients With Stroke in Subacute Phase.

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca

leadSponsor.name: Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca

collaborators.name: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Assess the effect of inspiratory muscle training on lung function, muscle strength and trunk balance in survivors of stroke in the subacute phase of the disease
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Assess the effect of inspiratory muscle training on lung function, muscle strength and trunk balance in survivors of stroke in the subacute phase of the disease. The intervention will be done in a group of patients who will be treated in the rehabilitation service at the Virgen de la Arrixaca Hospital. They will train using a threshold IMT device or a Powerbreathe device, to increase their inspiratory muscle strength in addition to a physical therapy treatment. The intervention will last eigtht weeks and the patients will be evaluated at the beginning and at the end of the intervention.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: There are two groups, the intervention group and the placebo group.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: The study is blinded so neither the patient, neither the psysical therapist nor the investigator knows in which group the patient is

armGroups.label: IMT-GE
armGroups.description: the participants will perform a training protocol of the inspiratory muscles during 8 weeks with a load that will increase from the 15% of the maximal inspiratory preassure until the 60% of the maximal inspiratory preassure.

armGroups.label: IMT-GP
armGroups.description: The participants will perform a training protocol of the inspiratory muscles during 8 weeks with a load that will be the 10% of the maximal inspiratory preassure during all the 8 weeks

interventions.name: IMT
interventions.description: A training protocol of the inspiratory muscles that goes from the 15% of the maximal inspiratory muscle preassure until the 60% of the maximal inspiratory muscle preassure during 8 weeks

primaryOutcomes.description: The change of the maximum inspiratory pressure from the beginning, at 4 weeks and At 8 weeks
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the first day of evaluation and at eight weeks of the beginning of the intervention

primaryOutcomes.description: The change of the forzed vital capacity from the beginning and at the end of the intervention
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the first day of evaluation and at eight weeks of the beginning of the intervention

primaryOutcomes.measure: Forzed espiratory volume in the first second
primaryOutcomes.description: The change of the forzed espiratory volumen in the first second beginning and in the end of the intervention using a spirometer
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the first day of evaluation and at eight weeks of the beginning of the intervention

primaryOutcomes.description: The change of the voluntary maximum ventilation from the beginning and at the end of the intervention using a spirometer
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the first day of evaluation and at eight weeks of the beginning of the intervention

primaryOutcomes.description: The change of the balance at the beginning and in the end of the intervention using the berg balance scale tool. The máximum value of this scale is 56 points, and the mínimum is 0 points. A higher value represents a better outcome.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the first day of evaluation and at Eight weeks of the beginning of the intervention

primaryOutcomes.measure: The postural assessment scale for stroke patients (PASS )test
primaryOutcomes.description: The change of the balance of the trunk at the beginning and in the end of the intervention using the postural assessment scale for stroke patinents tool. The maximum value of tris scale is 36 points. The minimum is 0 points.Higher values represents a better outcome.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the first day of evaluation and at Eight weeks of the beginning of the intervention

primaryOutcomes.description: The change of the trunk control at the beginning and in the end of the intervention. The maximum value is 100 points, and the minimum 0 points. Higher values represents a better outcome
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the first day of evaluation and at Eight weeks of the beginning of the intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: The change of the quadriceps´s strength with a hand held dynamometer at the beginning and in the end of the intervention. Higher values represents a better outcome
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the first day of evaluation and at eight weeks of the beginning of the intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: The change of the walking capacity using the functional ambulatory classificator tool at the beginning and in the end of the intervention. The máximum value is 5 and the mínimum 0. Higher values represents a better outcome
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the first day of evaluation and at Eight weeks of the beginning of the intervention

secondaryOutcomes.measure: "Functional ambulatory classificator Hospital de Sagunto" Test
secondaryOutcomes.description: The change of the walking capacity using the functional ambulatory classificator hospital de sagunto tool at the beginning and ni the end. The máximum value is 5 and the mínimum 0. Higher valúes represents better outcome
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the first day of evaluation and at Eight weeks of the beginning of the intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: The change of the quality of life related to health with the SF-36 health survey at the beginning and in the end of the intervention
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the first day of evaluation and at eight weeks of the beginning of the intervention

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Sroke 6 months before of the beginning of the study
* Be able to understand simple commands
* Hemiparesis or hemiplegia
* Not have serious cardiopulmonary diseases(COPD,asthma,bronchiectasis)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Associated neurological pathology leading to muscle weakness
* Severe respiratory pathology, pulmonary embolism, presence of tracheostomy cannula,
* intracranial hypertension
* Acute retinal datachment, recent eye surgery
* Impossibility of labial occlusion
* Unstable heart disease, unstable angina, aortic aneurysm
* Recent thoracic or abdominal surgery(6 months)
* Uncontrolled arterial hypertension
